body.p:
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlette.
Governor.

On visiting the Pententiary to day found a soldier belonging to My Regt. confined there. His name is James Farrel, and as I learn he was sent here from Louisville for a charge of stealing a horse. It is not probable to My Mind that Farrel was guilty of the crime for he was a good soldier and had never shown any dishonesty in the Regt. He was at the time of taking possession Of the very much distracted in Mind from previous drinking excessively.
It was known that from that cause he was once before deranged for a time
Now he wants to return to his regiment and I respectfully ask your Excellency pardon him & send him to the Regt.

Verry Respectfully
Your Obt Svt W. P. Boone Col 28 Ky

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Jas Farrell
Horse Stealing
Ascertain the date of correction & the term of & issue Pardon
